mentions.context: We tested U-Net++ on 40 vol (600 images), using disc and vertebra annotations.

publisher.rawForm: Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
publisher.normalizedForm: Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

mentions.context: Material and methods: : We developed, on one hand, a Picture Archiving and Communication System (PACS) with a DICOM viewer (Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine) to extract training data and implement 2 CNN networks dedicated to the segmentation task and on the other hand, the analysis of simple lumbar pathologies on the other hand.Two hundred forty-four MRI scans T2 weighted sagittal were selected at the university hospital Pasteur 2 of Nice -France.After accomplishing segmentation and classification task for all structures of interest, we trained two neural networks (U-Net++ and Yolov5x) to segment and detect discs and vertebras.

Material and methods: : We developed, on one hand, a Picture Archiving and Communication System (PACS) with a DICOM viewer (Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine) to extract training data and implement 2 CNN networks dedicated to the segmentation task and on the other hand, the analysis of simple lumbar pathologies on the other hand.Two hundred forty-four MRI scans T2 weighted sagittal were selected at the university hospital Pasteur 2 of Nice -France.After accomplishing segmentation and classification task for all structures of interest, we trained two neural networks (U-Net++ and Yolov5x) to segment and detect discs and vertebras.
